name: The Makers Podcast
slogan: The community for founders disrupting millennial markets

team.title: Founder
team.name: Ollie Forsyth
team.bioHtml: The Makers Podcast show interviews the most high profile entrepreneurs to find out how they screwed-up. We currently have 75k weekly listeners

jobs.title: Makers Community Manager Edinburgh
jobs.description:
Hello Makers! 

Firstly, please do not apply to this role if you are not based in Edinburgh.

The Makers Podcast is a podcast show, interviewing the most high profile entrepreneurs on how they screwed-up. To date, we have interviewed founders from Leon Restaurants, Honest Burgers, Netflix & Monzo to name a few. 

Once a month, we host a live podcast event with 2-3 notable business leaders finding out some of the mistakes they have made along the way. Generally, each of our events are sector focused such as, FinTech, Healthcare, Retail, FMCG etc. We are excited to be expanding to Edinburgh 

We are looking for a part time entrepreneurial community manager to help us grow The Makers brand in Edinburgh but your responsibilities are as follows: 

This role involves you: 

- Organising one event per month with the target of having 100 attendees per event 
- Marketing our series of events and reaching our revenue targets 
- Heading up our events from beginning to end 
- Building our local community of entrepreneurs and being a point of contact for them 

Benefits of joining our team:

- Access to a huge network of leading business leaders, investors and many of the leading FTSE 250 companies 
- Exposure to the entrepreneurs space 
- Be part of something potentially big 
- Access to many of the worlds leading conferences 

The Makers will provide and organise, venue & speakers so no need to worry about that! 

Our starting monthly salary would be £500-£750 with the intention to hire you full time for our other events we are starting to host across the UK as well as leading and heading up our conferences which we are soon to launch & announce.

Benefits of joining our team:

- Access to a huge network of leading business leaders, investors and many of the leading FTSE 250 companies 
- Exposure to the entrepreneurs space 
- Be part of something potentially big 
- Access to many of the worlds leading conferences 

The Makers will provide and organise, venue & speakers so no need to worry about that! 

Our starting monthly salary would be £500-£750 with the intention to hire you full time for our other events we are starting to host across the UK as well as leading and heading up our conferences which we are soon to launch & announce.
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Hello Makers!

Firstly, please do not apply to this role if you are not based in Lisbon.

The Makers Podcast is a podcast show, interviewing the most high profile entrepreneurs on how they screwed-up. To date, we have interviewed founders from Leon Restaurants, Honest Burgers, Netflix & Monzo to name a few.

Once a month, we host a live podcast event with 2-3 notable business leaders finding out some of the mistakes they have made along the way. Generally, each of our events are sector focused such as, FinTech, Healthcare, Retail, FMCG etc. We are excited to be expanding to Lisbon.

We are looking for a part time entrepreneurial community manager to help us grow The Makers brand in Lisbon but your responsibilities are as follows:

This role involves you:

  • Organising one event per month with the target of having 100 attendees per event
  • Marketing our series of events and reaching our revenue targets
  • Heading up our events from beginning to end
  • Building our local community of entrepreneurs and being a point of contact for them

Benefits of joining our team:

  • Access to a huge network of leading business leaders, investors and many of the leading FTSE 250 companies
  • Exposure to the entrepreneurs space
  • Be part of something potentially big
  • Access to many of the worlds leading conferences

The Makers will provide and organise, venue & speakers so no need to worry about that!

Our starting monthly salary would be £500-£750 with the intention to hire you full time for our other events we are starting to host across the UK as well as leading and heading up our conferences which we are soon to launch & announce.

jobs.title: Makers of FinTech Conference Internship
jobs.description:
Hey Makers

Ollie here, founder and host of The Makers Podcast - a podcast show where we interview the most notable business leaders on how they screwed-up. To date, we have interviewed founders from companies such as: Netflix, Monzo, YO! Sushi and Depop to name a few. 

We are excited to be launching our own FinTech conference on May 21st so we are on the search for the best entrepreneurial individuals to come and help us make the conference a huge success. Although this will be done on a internship / volunteer basis, we want to help you as much as possible. Below is a short summary of what your role may involve, plus some of the benefits we can hep you with: 

You role may involve: 

1. Organising speakers to come and speak at our event 
2. Marketing the event - creating and executing marketing strategies 
3. Create a social media & brand presence for the conference 
4. Inviting the media to come & attend the event 
5. Ticket sales 
6. Creating brand & visuals 

Benefits: 

1. Access to a large high profile network of entrepreneurs, VC's & Corporates 
2. Be part of the community for budding entrepreneurs (we are soon to launch The Makers in Europe) 
3. A notable community to have on your CV 
4. A CV reference will be provided 

The conference is taking place on May 21st in London, so we will need you around that day. All travel expenses on the day will be covered. 

More details available once you apply. 

We would love to hear from you - so we look forward to hearing from you soon. 

Kind regards, 

Ollie
